articles.title: About my blog
articles.description: Here is a collection of work samples I have created over the past few semesters as well as a list of my coursework and work experience.

articles.title: Untitled
articles.description: A new article created using the Distill format.
articles.contents:
Distill is a publication format for scientific and technical writing, native to the web.
Learn more about using Distill for R Markdown at https://rstudio.github.io/distill.

articles.title: Scope and Methods of Political Science
articles.description: Here is a sample of work I created for my Scope and Methods of Political Science Course.
articles.contents:
Below is a research project proposal I created for this course.
This research proposal centered on the topic of protectionism in U.S. foreign policy and its relationship with a reluctance among political leaders to participate in international governmental organizations.
Here it is:
Page 1Page 2Page 3Page 4Page 5Page 6Page 7

articles.title: Politics of Juvenile Justice Op-ed
articles.description: Here is a sample of work I created for my Politics of Juvenile Justice Course..
articles.contents:
Below is a sample of an op-ed I wrote for this course.
The topic of the op-ed concerns the practice of transferring juvenile offenders to the adult prison system. In this op-ed, I advocate for state-wide reform to the juvenile justice system by raising the age of juvenile court jurisdiction to the age of 18.
Here it is:
Page 1Page 2

articles.title: The Global Workplace/London Internship Creative Project
articles.description: Here is a sample of work I created for my Global Workplace course/internsip while studying abroad in London.
articles.contents:
Below is a database I created for this course using Excel.
For my creative project, I created a sample risk assessment database for international journalists planning to create media abroad. I chose this topic while I was interning at One World Media, a non-profit organization focused on expanding the capacity of international journalists to create stories in developing countries.
Here it is:
Page 1Page 2Page 3

articles.title: Editorial & Persuasive Writing Virginia Governor Endorsement
articles.description: Here is a sample of work I created for my Editorial & Persuasive Writing Course..
articles.contents:
Below is a sample of an editorial I wrote for this course.
For this assignment, our class came to a consensus on who we as an editorial board would endorse for the Virginia Gubernatorial Race. Our class decided to endorse Ms. Jennifer Carroll Foy for Virginia Governor.
Here it is:
Page 1Page 2

articles.title: Politics of Juvenile Justice Presentation
articles.description: Here is another sample of work I created for my Politics of Juvenile Justice Course.
articles.contents:
Below is a presentation of my research topic for this course.
Expanding on my previous op-ed in my first post, I created a bill to lobby to Congress to raise the age of juvenile court jurisdiction in the U.S. among individual states. I then picked a legislator to advocate for my bill toward its hopeful passage in both houses.
Here it is:
Page 1Page 2Page 3Page 4Page 5

articles.title: Humanitarian Assistance/International Development Law Presentation
articles.description: Here is a sample of work I created for my Humanitarian Assistance/International Development Law Course.
articles.contents:
Below is a sample of a presentation I created for this course.
For this project, we each designated our own topic of interest to focus on throughout the semester that pertains to the field of international development. I chose to explore the status of educational opportunities for Syrian refugees in the countries in which they sought asylum.
Here it is:
Page 1Page 2Page 3Page 4Page 5Page 6Page 7Page 8

articles.title: Experience
articles.description: Here are my undergraduate work experiences and a list of courses I’ve taken at George Washington University.
articles.contents:
Global Risk Advisors | New York, NY September-December 2020
Research Analyst Intern
Conduct in-depth market research, due diligence research, open-source intelligence gathering, and geopolitical risk assessments for clients
Create client-facing reports and memos on relevant legislation and people of interest
Track and follow relevant news for use in client projects
Dykema Gossett PLLC – Government Policy Practice | Washington, D.C. September-December 2019
Legal Assistant
Analyzed Congressional briefings and developed bimonthly legislative update memos for clients
Conducted research on Congressional committees and legislation to advise clients
Attended Congressional briefings between clients and congressional offices
Compiled contact databases for both corporate and government representatives
One World Media | London, UK January-March 2020
Intern
Created a sample database of international risk assessments and legal restrictions for journalists
Corresponded with journalists to recognize pieces for the One World Media Awards ceremony
Compiled database of foundation grants for international journalism
The Partnership for Inner-City Education | New York, NY May-August 2018
Development Intern
Served as an interim Academic Development Associate at Sacred Heart School in Bronx, NY
Analyzed admissions and scholarship data for Partnership Schools to increase enrollment
Advertised elementary school education to parents in New York City
GW UNICEF | Washington D.C. 2018-present
Fundraising Team Member
• Organized various fundraisers on campus to raise money and advocate for UNICEF, particularly women’s education and clean drinking water for all

articles.title: Welcome to my blog!
articles.description:
Welcome to my new blog, Aidan's Blog. I hope you enjoy 
reading what I have to say!
